title: Canyon De Chelly National Monument: Management
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management             Management              MANAGEMENT OF THE PARK Canyon de Chelly National Monument is unique from most other national park units in that the park is located on Navajo tribal trust lands with a community of Navajo families living in the canyons. As such, administration of the park requires the National Park Service and the Navajo Nation to work together to protect and preserve the park resources. Read the Administrative History of the Park for information about the creation of the park. For questions regarding management, please call the Park Superintendent or Deputy Superintendent at 928-674-5500.        The park continues work on the watershed within the park. Read the Tamarisk/Russian Olive EA (1,207 KB) for more details about this ongoing project.
